data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Jigawa, Nigeria not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Jigawa, Nigeria
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, please send teachers of your Word in Jigawa who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Jesus, please help the 729,050 believers in the state of Jigawa to be filled with joyful obedience at all times, as you modeled for us all.
Father, encourage the 729,050 believers to have boldness before you, since they have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God.
data.verse: Since then we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

data.prayer: Father, 0.0% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Lord, stir the hearts of your people in the state of Jigawa to agree with you and with one another in love.
data.verse: that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

data.prayer: Father, if there is even one of the 729,050 believers in Jigawa, Nigeria who does not have a Bible, please provide them one today.

data.section_summary:
the state of Jigawa, Nigeria has a population of 2,829,900.

We estimate Jigawa has 729,050 people who might know Jesus, 720,136 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 1,380,714 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 3 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Jigawa.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.
